story: NewsDerek Hatton allowed back into Labour -  years after being kicked outEXCLUSIVE He was expelled for belonging to the hard-left Militant factionShareByBen GlazeDeputy political editorOliver Milne:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsDerek Hatton has been allowed to rejoin the party "Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailDerek “Degsy” Hatton has been allowed back into Labour -  years after being kicked out for belonging to the hard-left Militant faction. The former deputy leader of Liverpool’s City Council triggered a national outcry in the s by setting an illegal budget and was blasted for sending redundancy notices by taxi to thousands of council workers.He was expelled and in the Labour wilderness for nearly three decades.He claimed in September he had been readmitted - but Labour sources said at the time he was not a member. Refusing to “talk about particulars”, Mr Hatton, , confirmed “processes have happened”, adding: “I am a member of the Labour Party.” He said: “During that -odd years that I was expelled, I never once stood against, supported, voted against any Labour candidate.“It’s very topical it should be at the time when seven members resigned today because obviously there were times when it was very tempting to go a dferent way - during the Iraq War, loss of Clause IV, many things - but I believed then as I believe now the Labour Party is the political arm of the trade union movement. “Whatever is happening, that’s the place to stay.” Liverpool Mayor Joe Anderson said: “I’m happy to have Derek Hatton back in the Labour Party. “What happened in the past was a product of its time, but he has now committed himself to the kind of sensible socialism that we’re doing here in Liverpool and want to see UK wide.”

title: independent groups office revealed above
story: NewsIndependent Groups office revealed - above Brexit-backing Wetherspoons called The UnicornIts a new pro-Remain movement. Its founded on rational solutions to politics. So of course the Independent Group is based above a branch of Brexit-backing Wetherspoons called The UnicornShareCommentsByDan BloomOnline Political Editor:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsThe registered offices of Gemini A Ltd - which is the vehicle for the new independent group of MPsLtd"Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailIts the HQ of Britains newest political movement. You might have expected the Independent Groups office to be a glittering palace of Remain - a testament to its fresh, evidence-based take on politics. You might not expect to find this EU-loving powerhouse above a Wetherspoons - whose founder is a thumping Brexiteer. And you definitely wouldnt expect the name of the pub below this rational, sensible, definitely-not-pie-in-the-sky group. Its called... *cough*... The Unicorn. But sure enough, this out-of-place office in Altrincham, Greater Manchester, now has a link to the group of seven MPs who quit the Labour Party today. It was registered last month as the HQ of Gemini A Ltd, a company run by Labour MP Gavin Shuker - one of the gang of seven who declared independence this morning.  The MPs say the company, also registered last month, exists to support the work of their new breakaway group. Unusually, theres little  supporting them - for now. Their group is only registered through a private company - not as a formal political party through the Electoral Commission watchdog. That raised speculation earlier today about whether the group would, in its current form, have to declare all its donations from private backers. Under the law, inidual MPs have to declare donations over a certain amount - and so do the political parties they belong to.   But private companies do not. That raised the question of whether donors could remain anonymous by donating to Gemini A Ltd. Gemini A Ltd could then, the theory went, have its own staff and donate to the inidual MPs without the ultimate source of the cash being known. After the Mirrors enquiries, the Electoral Commission tonight said it had contacted the MPs to understand the structure of the Group. A spokesman for the Independent Group insisted this is only Day One and appeared to indicate the group could be registered as a full political party in future. Thatd be needed, in any case,the group wants to field candidates at the next election. Without being registered as a political party, the Independent Groups MPs could stand for Parliament - but they would have to just stick independent next to their name, with no logo or brand.   The group is talking to the Electoral Commission as soon as possible, and we are committed to following the rules that the Commission... set out, a spokesman for the MPs said. We expect the publication of guidance though the Electoral Commission, butnot we will publish it on our website, in the same way that political parties do. The Independent Group is not a political party, as was set out this morning. But we will be talking to the Electoral Commission to clary the rules as soon as possible. Being linked to a private company does not usually raise questions over transparency in itself. Other political parties, such as UKIP, use a private firm as a vehicle. Registering a new party means handing over a small fee of pound, drawing up a party constitution and a financial statement and nominating a leader and a treasurer.  An Electoral Commission spokesman said: “The Members of Parliament that are part of this group will continue to be required to report to the House of Commons any donations above pound, that they receive in their capacity as a ‘regulated donee’. We have contacted the Independent Group to understand the structure of the Group and any further obligations on them inidually or collectively to report donations.” It was not immediately clear why the firm was registered in Altrincham - which is  miles from Mr Shukers constituency in Luton, Bedfordshire, and home to Tory grandee Sir Graham Brady. Private companies sometimes have no physical presence at their registered office, which can simply be the HQ for that firms accountants, for example.

story: NewsIndependent Group: What happens now for Labour and Brexit after split by  MPsChuka Umunna and six other MPs have announced a Labour split. But what does it actually mean for Brexit - and Jeremy Corbyn  Here is what happens next:ShareByNicola BartlettPolitical Correspondent:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB Newsthis.style.displaynone"Video LoadingVideo UnavailableClick to playTap to playThe video will start in CancelPlay now,adData:,videoData:,mainEntityOfPage:https:www.mirror news politics video watch-highlights-labour-split-speeches-,customFields:,suggestedData:,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,],gtmContainerId:GTM-MTHP,gtmFbiaContainerId:GTM-PNLXFZS,trackingData:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true,info:,article:,info:],hasLeadVideo:true,interaction:,features:, offlineSupport :, combinedPrompt :true, scope :  news politics  , theme : # , title : Mirror Politics ,bundledCss:,swipeNavigation.endpoint:https:mab.data.tm-awx pwa-swipe,mvtTests.enable:true,swipeNavigation:true""Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA group of seven MPs have resigned from Labour to create a new Independent Group in the House of Commons. It is the most signicant split in British politics since the breakaway of the Social Democratic Party in the s. Chuka Umunna,LucianaBerger, Chris Leslie, Angela Smith, Gavin Shuker, Mike Gapes and Ann Coffey are among the MPs from the partys centrist wing who have been the loudest critics of Jeremy Corbyns leadership, his stance on Brexit and his handling of allegations of anti-Semitism. In a Statement of Independence, setting out their values and approach, they promised to pursue policies that are evidence-based, not led by ideology, taking a long-term perspective to the challenges of the st century in the national interest, rather than locked in the old politics of the th century in the parties interests. None of the current political parties in Westminster are fit to provide the leadership and direction needed by our country, they said. And they pledged: As an Independent Group we aim to recognise the value of healthy debate, show tolerance towards dferent opinions and seek to reach across outdated ides and build consensus to tackle Britains problems. What happens now    The MPs have said they will sit as Independents in the House of Commons. They will remain on the opposition side of the chamber next to their former Labour colleagues. At the moment they are just an informal group of MPs without a leader, staff or a formal party structure. They say they will make the decision whether or not to formalise their status later this week. If they want to become a political party they would need to register with the Electoral Commission. That means handing over a fee of pound, drawing up a party constitution and a financial statement and nominating a leader and a treasurer.  So far there are no plans for these MPs to call by-elections but, as they were elected on a Labour Party  and a Labour manesto they may face growing pressure to go back to their constituents. Angela Smith told Politics Live that her constituents were aware of her stance when she campaigned at the last election -including her Brexit stance and disagreements with the Labour leader. Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell said the MPs should have stayed and fought their corner within the party. He said: I think you have a responsibility to go back to the electorate. Who could join them  Chuka Umunna extended an invitation to MPs from other parties to join them. In a call on other MPs to quit their parties, MrUmunnasaid: You might come from a Labour background but you might come from other political traditions. Yes, its a dficult decision - make no mistake about that. He added: We invite you to leave your parties and help us forge a new consensus on a way forward for Britain. There are a number of Labour MPs who agree with this group and may have already considering leaving. Owen Smith, who stood against Jeremy Corbyn in  has not ruled out joining the group. Outspoken Jeremy Corbyn critic John Woodcock, who quit the party last year, praised those who had broken away but has, as yet, not said he would join them. He tweeted: It was inspiring and humbling to see my friends setting out why they are leaving the Labour Party to start something new. A sad day for them but the beginning of a time of great hope for all those of us who want our country and our politics to change. There are a number of other Labour MPs who are currently sitting as independents within the House of Commons with some suggesting Ivan Lewis could join the grouping. It is less likely that Frank Field, the long standing MP for Birkenhead, will join them with some indication that he wants to rejoin Labour.   Mr Umunna extended his invitation to MPs from across the political spectrum. He has a relationship through his campaigning against Brexit with Anna Soubry who has suffered threats of deselection and abuse for backing Remain. But so far she has not commented on whether she would be tempted to join. What does it mean for the Brexit votes   The short answer is very little. The seven MPs are staunch Remainers who have become serial rebels against the Labour Party.One of the main Remain groups The Peoples Vote campaign released a statement distancing themselves from the new project. A spokesman reiterated the campaigns cross-party nature saying: “We are not a political party, nor are we ever going to allow ourselves to be associated with just one faction of any political party. We are a campaign for aPeople’sVote. We are supported by a cross-party group of MPs, as well as by members of the public from all parties and of none. “Some MPs will have their own reasons for wanting to resign from a particular political party but, as a campaign, we are still working towards securing the support of the Labour front bench. What does it mean for Labours Brexit policy   This is a far more interesting question.On the one hand losing a group of rebellious MPs could just mean Jeremy Corbyn and Sir Keir Starmer can continue with a strategy of keeping all options on the table - including a Peoples Vote. But with a group of MPs seen as on the right of Labour having left, this may make it easier to separate the issue of loyalty to Corbyn and opposition to Brexit and allow more MPs to come out in favour of a second vote.Last week a group calling themselves Love Socialism, Hate Brexit met for the first time. This group included a number of shadow frontbenchers including Clive Lewis and others who are seen as loyal to the leadership.  Theresignationof seven Labour members of parliament means the party now has  MPs in the House of Commons -  down on the total won at the  general election. On Sunday Shadow Chancellor John McDonnell warned potential splitters that they risked handing the Tories power for a decade in reference to his opinion of the SDPs role in Margaret Thatchers election success. One of the biggest Labour-supporting have said a split party doesnt win elections but Unisons General Secretary Dave Prentis also said it was up to Jeremy Corbyn to reach out to MPs. UNISON general secretary Dave Prentissaid: “Working people need a Labour government but split parties don’t win elections. Labour’s overriding concern must be to look long at hard at the reasons why the MPs feel they are no longer able to stay in the party. GMB general secretary Tim Roache warned that it would be unforgivable for any of those MPs who left the party today were to stand against Labour MPs. He said: I gritted my teeth through the Blair era, when I disagreed with the Labour government on a host of issues. But I stayed in the party because Labour in power is always better than the alternative. It would be unforgivable now for those who have resigned to stand against good Labour candidates, risking a Tory government. Unites general secretary Len McCluskey, who is the closest union boss to the labour leader, said: It is what it is its a group of iniduals who have decided to go a dferent path from the  that they stood on just  months ago. He said there was a strong whf of hypocrisy here adding that they all received increased majorities not because of their own personal charisma but because of the Labour manesto.He added: History will judge them. If they regard themselves as democrats I wondertheyre going to stand down and create by-elections.Campaign group Momentum, which helped Jeremy Corbyns election as Labour leader, dismissed the breakaway groups politics as ato the politics of the past. And they poured scorn on the MPs ability to inspire the same grassroots response as Corbyns Labour. LauraParker, Momentum National Coordinator, said:With a back to the Blair years programme of privatisation, tax cuts for the rich and deregulation of the banks, they offer no concrete solutions, no new ideas and have no support amongst the public.Across Europe, parties stuck in the middle of the road mould have no young supporter base to speak of and are plummeting in the polls, enabling the rise of the far right. Tens of thousands of volunteers regularly come out and campaign for Labour. This fringe minority of MPs have today not set out any agenda capable of inspiring anything remotely similar.” What does it mean for Jeremy Corbyn   The seven MPs quitting means Jeremy Corbyn is finally rid of a group of MPs who have been a thorn in his side and openly hostile to him since he became leader. But a lot will depend on how the Labour reacts to the departures. The Labour leader have so far expressed his disappointment and talked about bringing people together. He said in a statement: I am disappointed that these MPs have felt unable to continue to work together for the Labour policies that inspired millions at the last election and saw us increase our vote by the largest share since . Labour won people over on a programme for the many not the few – redistributing wealth and power, taking vital resources into public ownership, investing in every region and nation, and tackling climate change.The Tories are bungling Brexit while Labour has set out a unying and credible alternative plan. When millions face the misery of Universal Credit , rising crime, homelessness and poverty, now more than ever is the time to bring people together to build a better future for us all.

story: NewsAlesha MacPhail trial: CCTV shows shadowy figure carrying something along shorelineA -year-old boy denies raping and murdering Alesha, whose body was discovered in woodland on the Isle of Bute, Scotland, last JulyShareBySophie EvansKeith McLeod:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsJurors have heard Alesha MacPhail had  separate injuries "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe Alesha MacPhail murder trial has been shown CCTV footage of a shadowy figure carrying something along a shoreline. Six-year-old Aleshas body was discovered in woodland on the Isle of Bute in the Firth of Clyde, Scotland, on July  last year. Jurors have heard she had  separate injuries. A -year old boy is on trial at Glasgows High Court, accused of abducting, raping and murdering the girl - which he denies. This morning, the court heard evidence from Detective Constable Lisa Whitelock, who was CCTV coordinator in the case. She said footage appeared to show a “shadowy figure” moving along the shoreline in Rothesay, carrying a mystery object.  Jurors were told the figure “slows down and appears to be carrying something in front of them” in the footage. They also heard that something appears to be “hanging down” at the front of the figure as it moves along the shore front. The accused teenager, who cannot be named for legal reasons, denies taking Alesha from the home her grandparents shared with her dad. He also denies raping and murdering her, and trying to hide evidence. Earlier this morning, the trial heard that police recovered four Jamie Oliver kitchen knives from the boys home in Ardbeg Road, Rothesay.  A kne block was also recovered from the property on July , nine days after the schoolgirl was discovered dead, the court was told. The block had five holes, but there was no sign of a fth kne. Detective Constable Graham McIlwraith, of Police Scotland, said he attended the house with a search warrant following Aleshas death. Jurors were told that two of the four knives were found in the block, while the other two were on the drainer, theDaily Recordreported. When asked which make, Det Const McIlwraith said: Jamie Oliver. He told the court that he was aware that a kne had been recovered where by police, but he had not seen it.  Alesha had been staying in the house her dad shared with her grandparents when she was reported missing shortly after am. Her body was discovered hours later. Today is the trials sixth day of proceedings. The accused has lodged a special defence blaming Toni McLachlan - the girlfriend of Aleshas father, Robert MacPhail - for the killing. The trial, before judge Lord Matthews, continues.

title: madeleine mccann forensic scientist whos
story: NewsWoman who helped solve Stephen Lawrence death vows to take Madeleine McCann caseAngela Gallop CBE found the vital evidence that solved the deaths of Stephen Lawrence, Damilola Taylor and ‘God’s banker’ Roberto Calvi and now she wants to help find MaddyShareByJane Warren:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB News "Get the biggest Royal Family stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailBritains most prominent forensic scientist credited with solving some of this countrys most challenging crimes wants to take on the disappearance of Madeleine McCann. Angela Gallop CBE found the vital evidence that solved the deaths of Stephen Lawrence, Damilola Taylor and ‘God’s banker’ Roberto Calvi and now she wants to help find Maddy who vanished aged three from a holiday apartment in Praia da Luz, Portugal, in May  while her parents were dining in a nearby tapas restaurant with pals. It would be extraordinarily dficult because its in a dferent country and you dont know whats happened to the exhibits, she told the Sunday Times magazine. Ive been involved in cases where it looks hopeless, so Im not too daunted by anything these days. Every contact leaves a trace, its just finding it. In an interview with the  Jane Warren, Professor Gallop also spoke about her incredible career. In television dramas tend to give the impression that forensic scientists spend a lot of time crouching in ditches imagining things. Forensic biologist Professor Gallop says the scrupulous examination of crime scenes is just a tiny part of their work. The expert who proved to Operation Paget that Princess Diana was not pregnant when she died in Paris in  after testing a sample of her stomach contents says: “In that case, we knew what we had to do and did it, but cold cases are generally much less straightforward.The best bits have already been takenyou are doing DNA profiling for example, and you have to be really careful to not make the assumption that investigating officers fully understood the crime scene.”  In such cases, elaborate reconstructions need to be staged – sometimes years or even decades after a crime was committed. And so it was that Professor Gallop, , found herself directing her then husband Russell, also a forensic scientist, as he teetered upon the exact same scaffolding upon which Italian banker Roberto Calvi had been found hanged beneath London’s Blackfriars Bridge in June . Only this time, it had been erected in the bungalow of Professor Gallop’s garden in Newbury, Berkshire, a decade later. “At the instruction of his family, we set out to answer a simple question,” she says. “Had Calvi committed suicide as the autopsy had claimed, or had he been murdered  The challenge was to minimise the iables so you are left with the version nearest the truth.” The painstaking experiment eventually proved that Calvi could not have hanged himself from the scaffolding because the lack of paint and rust on his shoes proved that he had not walked on the scaffolding.  “Since then, I’ve designed all sorts of reconstructions,” says Gallop, who founded Oxfordshire-based Forensic Access in . From dripping blood into a telephone to work out how an injured person interacted with it, to shooting a suspended pig carcass with a shotgun to ascertain where the shot went. “It’s a little bit orced from the activity that gave rise to it – calmer, more analytical and normally helped by not meeting the people who are involved, until you see them in the dock that is. I remember seeing Peter Sutclfe, the Yorkshire Ripper in whose case I was involved, and thinking how inoffensive he looked. Evil can come with many faces.” In , her team’s painstaking recreations of Rachel Nickell’s traumatic final moments, as well as detailed examination of intimate body samples such as fingernail cuttings, led to the conviction of Robert Napper,  years after he brutally murdered the young mother on Wimbledon Common in  while she was walking with her two-year-old son and their dog. “In our search for ‘foreign DNA’ that could have come from Rachel’s attacker, a scientist put on clothes similar to Rachel’s and a colleague – acting as the attacker and with black powder applied to his hands – pulled and pushed them until they resembled the distribution of Rachel’s clothing when her body was found,” she explains. “Residues of black powder indicated where contact had been greatest and where we should focus our testing.”  This approach revealed male DNA which had been missed during the initial investigation and which turned out to match DNA from Robert Napper, incarcerated in Broadmoor Hospital since  for the murder of another young woman and her son. Furthermore, when Gallop re-examined some hair combings taken from Rachel’s two-year-old son she found a tiny flake of red paint that matched the red paint on a steel toolbox that was among Napper’s possessions at Broadmoor. The professor’s evidence, which took more than two years to collate as part of Operation Edzell, also fully exonerated Colin Stagg who had been arrested in  and tried at the Old Bailey a year later before his case collapsed. During her remarkable -year career, Gallop has also been involved in correcting serious miscarriages of justice and solving some of the UK’s most challenging landmark cases. In  she and her team discovered the evidence that led to the convictions of the Preddie brothers for the manslaughter of ten-year-old Damilola Taylor in November , putting the four youngsters originally charged with the crime definitively in the clear. “The police got all the flak, but in fact the original forensic scientists had missed a blood stain on the back of a pair of trainers that matched Damilola’s DNA,” she says. “What made it even more interesting was the discovery of a textile fibre embedded in it that matched fibres from Damilola’s jumper. That meant it must have been transferred when the blood was wet.”  And in , she presented critical evidence in the retrial of the  murder of the -year-old prostitute Lynette White, leading to the conviction of Jeffrey Gafoor and following the exoneration of the Cardf Three in . Then, in , she was approached by the police about the Stephen Lawrence case, at that time the most high-profile unsolved crime in the UK. “My team and I had been doing some good work in the Rachel Nickell and Damilola Taylor cases, and the politan Police thought ‘Let’s try them with this’,” she explains. Lawrence was  when he was attacked and killed while waiting for a bus on a street in south-east London on April , . It was two weeks before police made any arrests. And when the five white suspects – including Gary Dobson and David Norris – were subsequently released without being charged, the Met was accused of not trying hard enough to solve the murder because the victim was black. Eleven years later, when it seemed that the trail from Lawrence’s killers had gone cold, Angela was approached to review the evidence in the finest possible detail. Her team began a detailed analysis of the clothes Stephen was wearing on day he was murdered and also examined garments, seized by the police, belonging to the suspects. “Inside the back of the neck of Dobson’s jacket we found a tiny blood stain measuring approximately . by . millimetres,” recalls Angela of that breakthrough moment. “When DNA profiling showed that it matched Stephen’s profile, our loose end had suddenly been tied up. “When the jacket was first examined, DNA profiling was not so advanced and you wouldn’t have been able to get a profile out of a tiny stain on a jacket.”  There was further gold when a microscopic search – akin “to finding an earring on a football pitch” – turned up several tiny pieces of cut hair on the suspects’ clothing that matched Stephen’s hair. Then came a y and intricate process to check that none of this evidence had been caused by “cross contamination” during historical forensic tests. This was a huge additional undertaking, but in this case Angela wanted her evidence to be a bullet-proof as possible. “We had all the usual reasons for wanting to ensure that the scientic evidence and our interpretation of it was watertight, but we were also acutely aware of the Lawrence family had been through such a lot already.” But on January , , on the basis of the new forensic evidence produced by Gallop and her colleague Ros Hammond, Dobson and Norris were found guilty of the murder of Lawrence and sentenced to  and  years in prison, respectively. “To get justice for Stephen was particularly satisfying,” says Gallop. “I’ve been to two memorial services for him and was invited by his mother Doreen to the second one. I said to her to say ‘If you ever want to understand the science to just ask’, and she wrote back to say one day she would.” Although Gallop comes across as hard as nails, she admits that sometimes the work can be harrowing – and indeed, her book should not be read by anyone of a sensitive disposition. “Some colleagues do get badly affected so we introduced counselling,” says the woman who started her career as an academic examining sea slugs and is not sure –she had her time again – that she would choose a career in forensic science. “The fall-out of trying desperately to be right all the time has ruined my small talk. If someone asks what I think about something I can’t make an unqualied statement, even about a cake I’m about to eat. It’s exhausting. To relax I love the drama of opera. I know it’s mad, but then le is mad.” And after a career spent examining the worst that humans can do to each other, she would know.

title: mum 27 takes life days
story: NewsMum, , takes own le days after shes drugged and raped by sex beasts who filmed it allJenna Johnson was found dead at her Thurso, Scotland home days after two men threatened to publish the video - taunting her that shed lose her kidsShareByMarcello Mega:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsThe -year-olds body was found at her home in Thurso "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA mum-of-two took her own le because she was drugged and raped by sex beasts who filmed the attack. Jenna Johnson died on January  however her family believe that the horric ordeal days earlier was the catalyst. The -year-olds body was found at her home in Thurso, Scotland after she failed to join her family for lunch at her mum’s house. Jenna was said to have been tormented by the thought of people in her home town finding out about the assault, report the Daily Record. After Jenna’s body was found, it was taken to Glasgow for a forensic examination. But tests were inconclusive because the sexual assault by two men happened days earlier, on the night of December  or early hours of December . Jenna told close friends and her little sister Ky the shyidentities of the two men who drove her to kill herself. Now her family wants justice.  And Ky and mum Carol Forrest have reached out to another Caithness family still demanding justice after more than five years. One of the men Jenna accused of rape is suspected locally to have murdered Stefan Sutherland, , in September , and to have got away with it. Police and the Crown Office continue to claim there were no suspicious circumstances surrounding Stefan’s death, despite a catalogue of evidence to the contrary. Stefan vanished after a night out in Lybster, Caithness, on September , . His body was found on the beach at nearby Occumster on September .  His blood was found on the walls of the suspect’s home and he had injuries consistent with being tortured when he was found. Carol said: “We know, and our whole community knows, that these two guys are evil and have carried out other sickening and violent crimes. “Stefan’s killer is the shyringleader. He thinks he is above the law and is a very dangerous man. He needs to be locked up or there will be more deaths.” Stefan’s dad Sandy said: “This guy should have been in jail for Stefan’s murder andhe had been, another family would not be suffering as we have.”  About a week before she died, Jenna had woken to find herself covered in bruises and scratches, with needle marks in one arm. As her head cleared, she recalled being seriously shysexually assaulted by one man and raped by another. The two told her they had filmed the attack and shythreatened to publish the video, taunting her that it would lead to the loss of her children. She showed Ky, , her arms after the assault.  Ky said: “One arm had needle marks and the other was covered in scrapes and bruises that looked like they had been made by fingers holding her down. “She didn’t tell me the full story but she told me who she had been with and I knew one of them was considered a murderer in our community. “She said she must have been drugged as she couldn’t remember clearly all that had happened. “I was actually angry at her for associating with them. “Over the Christmas period, she was subdued and quiet. But on Hogmanay, she brightened up, ordered a shymicrowave, things for the kids, shyornaments, candles and we talked about taking a winter trip together to Iceland and a summer holiday in New York.”  Carol added: “Jenna was not suicidal when she left her kids with me on Hogmanay. “Who orders things for their home and plans holidays when they intend to end their le  “In the morning, when I texted, ‘Happy New Year’ and she never replied, I got a bad feeling. She was coming to me to eat but she didn’t show and there was no sign of her on Facebook.” Worried, she called the police and two officers went with her and broke into Jenna’s flat, finding her dead inside. Later that day, Carol and Ky heard a full account of what Jenna had apparently gone through from friends. Ky said: “It seemed a few people in the community knew these two guys had drugged and raped her and filmed it, because they had actually been boasting about it. “They told Jenna they had filmed themselves doing sexual things to her and were shythreatening to send it to people, saying she’d lose her kids. “I don’t knowthey were blackmailing her or just enjoying having power over her but she was distraught. “Jenna was a loyal friend and totally devoted to her kids. “The thought of losing them would have been too much for her.” Her mum added: “I’m so angry with both these men. One is the ringleader and nothing about him surprises anyone who knows him but Jenna trusted the other one as a friend and he betrayed her.” The family has been told Jenna was drinking with the men when they turned on her, held her down and injected her with a sedative. Breaking down, Ky recounted how Jenna described the rape. She said: “We have told the police and the people she confided in have also made statements identying the men who did this, and they are both well known to the police. “We have no ideathey have been shyquestioned but we have been told that no video footage has been found and that they have been unable to access Jenna’s phone because it had a passcode. “Police told us it could cost pound to have an expert bypass the security and they would have to justy the cost to their bosses. “My sister was raped, threatened with public humiliation and I don’t know what  and she has killed herself as a result. “I don’t think you can put a price on doing everything possible to gather evidence to deliver justice.” Carol added: “The police appeared at first to want to push as hard as they could. “But we feel that it’s already been downgraded. There should be no argument about the phone being examined, no matter the cost. “Jenna was out with friends at a house party after leaving me on New Year’s Eve. They all say she was in good form. “She got a phone call and became agitated, but didn’t say who called or what it was about. “A text followed and her mood got even worse. When her friends moved on to another party, she wanted to go home. “She called me at about .am and told me to tell her kids she really loved them. I was half asleep and thinking she could tell them herself when she came for her dinner. “I didn’t realise there was anything major wrong and that it would be the last time we spoke. “The most important thing I can do now for my daughter is look after her children. “But I can also demand justice. She doesn’t have a voice any more so we have to speak for her. Too many serious and violent crimes have been swept under the carpet in this area in recent years. “Ky and I need to make sure this isn’t another one. “We want people to know how Jenna died and to know that eventhe men who raped and threatened her didn’t kill her with their own hands, they are responsible. “We won’t be fobbed off and we won’t stay quiet. “I had to bury my daughter two weeks after her th birthday. Our lives will never be the same. We are devastated. “Yet they remain free to walk around and choose their next victim.” Police said there were no shysuspicious circumstances surrounding Jenna’s death but refused to give further comment as there was an “ongoing investigation”. If you need to speak to someone, Samaritans are available   by calling   or by emailing jo@samaritans.org

story: NewsRubbish piles up as binmen strike over payments to non-strikers in old disputeMountains of waste are already piling up on streets in Birmingham - and the strike hasnt even begun yetShareCommentsByRichard McAllister:,  FEB NewsBinmen have walked out over payments to non-strikers during an earlier dispute "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailBinmen are today due to strike in shyprotest over alleged reward payments to workers who did not take part in previous industrial action. The last dispute over cuts in  led to shythousands of tons of waste being left uncollected for up to three months. title: stalker who dedicated britains talent
story: NewsStalker who dedicated Britains Got Talent audition to Miss England finalist jailedObsessed Jonathan Deal, , bombarded beauty queen Samantha Bumford, , with unwanted messages, and turned up at her shows uninvitedShareCommentsByJack Williams:,  FEB NewsJonathan Deal bombarded model Samantha Bumford with unwanted messages and turned up at her shows "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA Britains Got Talent rapper who stalked a Miss England finalist and dedicated his audition song on the show to her has been jailed.Obsessed Jonathan Deal, , harassed glamour model Samantha Bumford after falling in love with her on Facebook .He bombarded the beauty queen with unwanted messages on social media, and turned up uninvited at a number of her shows and once tried to kiss her as she left the stage. Deal, an aspiring rapper whose stage name is JAYD, told her he was going to audition for BGT with a song he wrote dedicated to his love for her. His infatuation culminated in him following her to the finals of Miss England in Nottingham where he tried to kiss her as she came off stage.   Ms Bumford, , said she was forced to shove him away and flee towards her family. Feeling spurned, Deal later sent her a message claiming you only did well in Miss England because the judges thought you were my girlfriend. Ms Bumford, a trainee primary school teacher from Poole, Dorset, was eventually forced to block her unwanted admirer on Facebook. Deal, who had previously pleaded guilty to a charge of harassment, was today sentenced to  weeks in prison by magistrates at Poole. Ms Bumford, the reigning Miss Poole and  Miss England Social Media queen, sobbed as she told the court of how the ordeal had completely ruined my le.  She said: Im constantly on edge and have been placed on medication because of this experience. For the first time since starting, I dont want to do this . Im not sleeping and am constantly looking over my shoulder. It has completely ruined my le. The magistrates heard how the stalking took place between August  and September  last year. On September  Deal, from Bournemouth, travelled  miles to watch her compete in the Miss England Beauty Championships. At the event he gted Ms Bumford a necklace which she wore on stage, a sign which Deal mis-read. After finishing in the top  she attempted to leave the floor but was accosted by Deal, who tried to forcibly kiss her on the lips.  Jason Spellman, prosecuting, said: The defendant has had a signicant impact on Ms Bumfords le and has a long record of incidents relating to stalking and harassment. He sent several messages via Facebook declaring his love for her. Each time she responded with a generic response saying she loved all her fans and thanking him for his support. On September  she was competing at a Miss England event in Nottingham when she came in the top . As she left the stage he grabbed her and the arms and body and tried to kiss her on the lips. She shouted for him to get off and had to be forceful.  Deal has  previous offences relating to harassment and stalking incidents dating back to . Simon Lacey, mitigating, said: Mr Deal sees things very literally and in this case has obviously misread some signs. He has troubles forming relationships and no one in the past has seemed to get to the root of the issue. In jailing him, magistrate Marion Mackay said: The impact you have had on the victim has been very serious and you have had an impact on her mental state. As there is a history of similar offences we think the incident is serious enough to warrant a custodial sentence. You will also be handed a restraining order running indefinitely. Deal was also handed an indefinite restraining order and ordered to pay pound compensation to Ms Bumford.

title: thousands back petition naive child
story: NewsThousands back petition as naive child sex abuser let off to protect careerChristopher Daniel was given an absolute discharge from court after a sherf appeared to blame his immaturity and social awkwardness for his behaviourShareByDanya BazaraaNews Reporter:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsChristopher Daniel abused a six-year-old girl for two years"Get the biggest politics stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailMore than , people have signed a petition calling for a review of the decision to let a teenager who sexually abused a child walk free. Christopher Daniel abused a six-year-old girl for two years - yet he was let off with no criminal record.A part-time sherf appeared to blame his immaturity and social awkwardness for his behaviour, referring to Daniel as naive.Daniel was given an absolute discharge, and Sherf Gerard Sinclairs reasoning behind his decision was released in a highly unusual move on Thursday. A Justice Office for Scotland statement said any recorded conviction for the offence would have serious consequences in terms of the accuseds future career as a dentist, the Daily Record reports.The move has caused a furious backlash from the childs family and the thousands who put their name to the petition within hours of its launch. Marisa Keegan started the petition on Friday calling for Justice Secretary Humza Yousaf to review the case. On the petition page, she wrote: Our system is putting criminals careers before our childrens welfare. What kind of world do we live in that this is seen as an acceptable decision by the court  She added: This decision is wrong. This sets an example for other sexual offenders and for sexual assault victims of what can happenthey come forward. By Saturday evening, more than , people had signed the petition. As it stands currently, , people have signed it. Daniel was  when he began abusing his young victim in . The Justice Office for Scotland statement said: “In light of the evidence as to the immaturity of the accused, and the nature of the discussion during which he admitted his actions, the sherf considered the offence to be the result of an entirely inappropriate curiosity of an emotionally naive teenager rather than for the purpose of sexual gratication. The accused had appeared both noticeably immature and socially awkward, features confirmed by other evidence in the case. It was fortunate that the complainer appeared to have suffered no injury or long lasting effects. It said any recorded conviction for the offence would have serious consequences in terms of the accuseds future career and any sentence would mean Daniel would probably be unable to continue his university course. But the mum of Daniel’s victim said she was “gobsmacked” by the decision to grant her attacker an absolute discharge at Dumbarton Sherf Court – meaning the student does not have a criminal record and was not put on the sex offenders’ register. She said: “We don’t want him locked up but he should be put on the sex offenders’ register. “As we suspected, the sherf also confirms his career was deemed to be more important. Sohe had not done as well in his exams at school, he would have been put on the sex offenders’ register ”  Conservative MSP Liam Kerr raised the case at First Ministers Questions on Thursday, telling Nicola Sturgeon the sherfs decision had devastated the victims family. Ms Sturgeon said: I absolutely understand the concerns that have been expressed about what has been reported about this sentence, but the sentencing decision in any criminal case is entirely a matter for the judge. The judiciary acts entirely independently on the basis of the facts and circumstances of inidual cases.They will take into account a wide range of factors, including the age of the offender and any previous convictions. I understand the concerns, but we must protect the principle in this country that sentencing decisions are not a matter for politicians, however controversial and dficult they can be for the public.Sentencing decisions are rightly and properly matters for judges.

title: woman 22 says surgery correct
story: NewsWoman, , says surgery to correct size A and C cup breasts changed her leLauren Watson, , said her uneven boobs meant she was often teased didnt have the confidence to wear tight clothesShareCommentsByNaomi Corrigan:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsLauren Watson, , was so low about her uneven boobs she went under the kne "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA girl with lopsided breasts has told of how the surgery to correct them “has changed her le”. Lauren Watson, , has such poor self-esteem because of her uneven boobs that she decided to spend nearly pound, on a drastic boob job. The student borrowed the money from her grandma and says now he can wear the clothes she has always dreamed of. The pound, boob job has made Lauren’s confidence “sky rocket”, she said.Speaking to Gazette Live , Lauren told of how one of her boobs used to be an A cup and the other was a C cup.Doctors promised Lauren her breasts would even out but they never did and people made hurtful comments about her asymmetrical breasts when she wore tight clothing. Its possibly the best thing I’ve done so far in my personal le, said the Teesside University student. It has changed my le an unbelievable amount.   “Ever since the age of  I’ve wanted breast surgery to change the way I looked and to provide me with more body confidence.” She continued: “I take a lot of pride in my appearance so when I looked in the mirror, I wanted to feel confident and comfortable in what I saw and for years I didn’t like what was looking back at me. “No amount of make-up made any dference to alter my mood as in my mind it was my body that was the problem. It was Laurens grandma Jean Watson who first suggested she go private. “My grandma has been amazing she even went with me for my first consultation. I couldn’t have done this without her help, said Lauren, who lives in Hartlepool. Jean lent her granddaughter the pound, for the surgery and Lauren is paying her back monthly. Lauren, who also works as a retail assistant, got smaller implants in the bigger breast and bigger implants in my smaller breast, and an uplt in the larger one.   She tried a number of sizes against each breast until herself and consultant cosmetic surgeon Christopher Dunkin at Nuffield Health Tees Hospital were happy they would sit quite evenly. Since the operation at Nuffield Health the contrast in my emotions has been immeasurable, she said. “For me the most important thing is my confidence and how I express that through my fashion because it is something I love. “I love that I have no limits now and I don’t have that voice in the back of my mind saying I can’t wear something because it won’t suit me. Or, it won’t look good on me because now I can wear anything and I truly feel amazing because of it.  About  per cent of women are thought to sort of breast size asymmetry. Breasts can grow with dferent amounts of fatty tissue, which becomes apparent in puberty. Mr Dunkin said breasts are an important part of body confidence for women. Most women have a slight dference between their breasts. But when they are completely dferent it can be very distressing, he said.

title: mum makes adorable gaffe maternity
story: NewsMum makes adorable gaffe with maternity skirt - but is hailed as a geniusLori Fuller only discovered what she was actually wearing when she Googled the brandShareCommentsByZahra MulroySocial Audience Editor:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsUpskirting is not currently a criminal offence "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailGetting dressed should be a piece of cake, but lets not forget the raft of oversights we all still make as adults. Price labels still stuck to the bottom of your snazzy new shoes  Standard. Wearing something inside out  Everyones done it. Skirt tucked into your knickers  Admit it, its happened to you. However, one mum-to-be recently made an adorable faux pas which is a new one on us. Lori Farrell headed to work dressed in what she believed to be a smart, stripy maternity skirt. It was only when she later Googled the brand that the penny dropped. Looks nice, doesnt it   Except, despite having extra material to allow for a growing bump, this wasnt a maternity skirt. Not even close. Instead, Lori was proudly sporting a baby car seat cover. The brand responsible for the car seat cover seat, Itzy Ritzy, werent the only ones who found it very funny. Speaking to Motherly , Lori explained:  A friend of mine had given me a huge lot of baby stuff, from clothes to baby carriers to a rocker and blankets and when I pulled it out I was not sure what it was. I debated it but washed it anyway then decided because of the way it pulled on the side it must be a maternity skirt.  When I got to work I googled the brand and realised not only do they not sell clothing but it was a car seat cover. As the responses show, Lori is not alone in making this sort of error.   I once let my husband borrow what I thought was a warm headband for a chilly outdoor event. Turns out he wore my black tube bra, added one woman. And Loris accidental re-purposing has also won her fans. Um this makes you a genius, added another. Any mom who can make multiple uses out of things before and after babies is a win. We couldnt agree more.

title: two simple tricks top chef
story: NewsTwo simple tricks top chef uses to get fussy kids to eat foods they dont likeCurtis Stone has two pieces of advice on how to get kids to try something theyre not keen onShareCommentsByZahra MulroySocial Audience Editor:,  FEB NewsCurtis practises what he preaches "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email Getting your child to embrace new foods and shed any fussy eating habits can become a battle of the wills.Unfortunately, its often the kids who emerge victorious. Sound familiar  Butyoure a frazzled parent whos run out of tricks, bribes and threats then help is at hand. TV chef Curtis Stone is father to Hudson, , and Emerson,  and has two tricks himself for getting reluctant children to eat something theyre suspicious of. Firstly,one of his sons arent keen on trying something new, the chef does this:  I tell them, thats what youre getting for dinner. And I will pack it in the lunch box again the next day, he told Mamamia .If you don’t repeat a food, the child will never get used to it. According to Stone its important to be firm. Oh, and forget about giving them a choice. The other thing is to not give them an option,Stone adds.  With us, when the kids get home from school, I always have a snack sitting out, like oranges. Theyre hungry, so thats what they will eat. So there you go. No disguising certain bits of food in dishes or elaborate distraction techniques - give them the food item until theyre familiar with it and dont give them a choice.

title: inside abandoned house haunted owner
story: NewsInside abandoned house so haunted owner says hello everyone every time he entersCurrent owners David Hunt and his mother Diana selling Upcott Barton farmhouse in Devon in the hope that someone canit to its former gloryShareCommentsByLaura ForsythGreg Martin:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsUpcott Barton farmhouse in Cornwall was abandoned over  years ago and is reputed to be haunted "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email An abandoned haunted house  that no one has lived in for more than  years has been put up for sale.Upcott Barton farmhouse in Devon benefits from stunning rural views, six acres of land with paddocks and also has a detached former chapel - but theres a hitch. Now current owners David Hunt and his mother Diana claim that the house is occupied by its previous occupants and that sometimes they can feel many eyes watching them in the property.David is so certain that the ghosts exist that each morning he enters the house and says: Good morning everyone.Now the pair have now put the property up for sale, hoping that someone canit to its former glory. He said: Sometimes you stand here and just feel that there are people around you, watching you - in a nice way. Its not nasty, you know. We speak to them.   When David and his mother, Diana, bought the farmhouse back in  it was in a dilapidated state and had been vacant since the late sixties. Their plan had always been to renovate the large manor house and move into it, but now they have decided to sell the property. David added: For some reason Ive ended up buying a lot of haunted houses. Ive renovated  properties. You come to realise when you start doing the work, you disturb the energies of the house, and whatever is there appears. Now, whether thats just me - and I dont think it is because Ive had a lot of other people say that - you just change the energies of the house.  Andthere are legends of ghosts, they tend to show themselves. Renovations that have been completed were done by David, and he said that during the work he made a series of fascinating discoveries. Whilst digging up earth at the side of the house one day, he discovered remains of a whole room that had been buried for at least a century. Within the rubble of part of the house that collapsed decades ago, David found the remains of an exquisite parquetry ceiling. He later found out that this ceiling was part of the houses library, when a woman who once lived in the house came to visit, and explained the layout of the Great Hall.   Several years ago, David says he met a travelling psychic who told him about the houses other-worldly residents. David says the man spoke a lot about the Civil War and how at the time soldiers would have shouted Nowhere to run, nowhere to hide. This expression shocked David, as another medium visited the house and said she spoke to a spirit who had once lived there who said: Nowhere to run, nowhere to hide. One historical account of a death in the house is found in a manuscript by former resident Alfred Chapman. He wrote down some of his family history after he emigrated to America in .  In it, Alfred writes about his sister, who was managing Upcott Barton when she died in , aged . He wrote: Mary Anne was a beautul, healthy looking young lady and was as good as she looked. The day before she died she appeared to be in perfect health except for a swelling in front of her throat which never appeared to trouble or inconvenience her except in its appearance. She died suddenly in the early morning. My brother George and I slept in a room adjoining sisters bedroom. Sometime in the morning before daylight I heard a scream and a noise like someone falling on the floor of my sisters room. It awoke me and I immediately jumped out of bed and ran into my sisters bedroom where I found Mary Anne on the floor and Elizabeth in bed holding on to Mary Annes hand trying to pull her in bed.   Elizabeth had been sound asleep also before the scream and fall, which awoke her. We lted Mary Anne in bed and she died in our arms without saying a word. The historically signicant Grade II Listed farmhouse is now on the market with planning permission - and a guide price of pound,. It is being sold by Stags estate agents. A spokesperson said: This Former Farmhouse is believed to date from the late medieval period with th century alterations. Now in a derelict state, plans have been drawn to create an exceptionally spacious distinctive four five bedroom residence retaining many character features. There are the remains of a medieval great hall and stair turret, together with a traditional cross passage.

title: mums shock after noting something
story: NewsMums shock after noticing something rather rude about her sons new lion toyA mum has called for a popular childrens toy to be banned after spotting something embarrassing about itShareCommentsByCourtney PochinAudience Writer:,  FEB NewsHakan discovered something surprising about his new toy "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid Email When mum-of-five Tanya Husnu purchased a toy lion for her son Hakan, she didnt look too closely at it.However she later wished she had paid more attention, after her three-year-old daughter Aylah, began yelling about the lions willy in a very crowded area.Upon closer inspection, the parent, , was shocked to discover that her young childs toy did indeed have a miniature penis underneath the tail.And now the mum is calling for the toys to be banned as she believes they are inappropriate.  The lion toy was purchased for  on February  from a branch of Kmart in Melbourne, Australia, along with several other animal toys, including an elephant and a hippo.According to Mrs Husnu, a professional blogger, the other animals do not feature any obvious genitalia.The concerned parent toldshe bought the toys for a trip to the local zoo. She said: We were planning a trip to the zoo and I thought it would be really greatthe kids could take some animal toys with them on the day. We went to Kmart and my three youngest picked out their own toys. They were all really happy with them. Then one of the twins turned the lion around, and my daughter yelled out Look mum, the lions got a willy and they all started laughing.   And things only continued to get more embarrassing when they actually went to the zoo. My kids thought it was hilarious, she continued. At the zoo, they kept lting up the the tail and showing strangers walking past the lions bits. Now, Mrs Husnu is hoping Kmart will stop selling the toy, because she feels its up to parents to tell their children about genitalia.   She added: I thought it was really inappropriate. In this day and age, its not acceptable to have things like that on childrens toys. I buy a lot of toys, and my house is full of toys. But Ive never seen anything like this before. Its so stupid and just plain weird.

title: overweight virgin who never boyfriend
story: NewsOverweight virgin who has never had boyfriend mysteriously gives birth to babyWoman in her s, from Guiyang, China refused to accept she was giving birth after being brought in to a hospital with abdominal painsShareByLaura ForsythJohn Feng:,  FEB Updated:,  FEB NewsA pregnant woman who had never had a boyfriend mysteriously gave birth to baby"Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailA pregnant woman who had never had a boyfriend mysteriously gave birth to a baby despite claiming to be a virgin . The woman in her s, from Guiyang, China refused to accept she was giving birth after being brought in to a hospital with abdominal pains. Doctors say that the educated woman, who was excessively overweight , had not noticed that she was pregnant because of her size. They added that she was genuinely surprised that she had ended up with a baby when hospital staff told her. She then complicated matters by insisting medics carry out a virginity test first before carrying out a C-section. The incident happened at a hospital in Guiyang, capital of Guizhou Province, according to Guiyang Evening Post on February .  The woman ended up in the hospitals emergency department after she was helped there by her parents and medics were stunned to learn that she was completely oblivious to the fact that she had started contractions - and was now going into labour. When the obstetrician broke the news, the patient in her s reportedly said: Impossible. Its not possible that Im pregnant!   The physician, who declined to be named in the report, said: She demanded that we perform a virginity test on her. It was very frustrating. According to hospital staff, the woman was adamant she could not be pregnant because she doesnt like men and has never had a boyfriend, much less sex. When her doctor asked whether it could have happened during some sort of drunken blackout, the patient claimed she was allergic to alcohol and doesnt touch booze. Medics suggested the woman was overweight, with her physique apparently masking the fact that a child had been growing in her womb for nine months. There was nothing more we could say to convince her that she was going into labour, the doctor said.   The hospital agreed to perform an emergency C-section on the woman and she gave birth to a baby boy on February , the second day of the new lunar year. However, the newborn was handed to the womans parents after she refused to nurse him. According to reports, the woman lives alone and, because of her weight and irregular menstrual cycle, never noticed she was pregnant. None of her friends noticed either. The hospitals head of obstetrics said: Its not the first time weve had a mother who only realised she was pregnant right before giving birth. They are usually underage and lacking in knowledge about their physiology. But this patient is in her s and was educated, so were particularly surprised. The report did not say whether the patient planned to give her son up for adoption. It is currently unclear who fathered the child.

Passengers spotted the creature when the Lion Air flight landed at Jakarta airport and travellers started the usual rush to get their hand luggage. A woman stood up to open the locker and the venomous creature scampered out, sparking panic from those onboard the Boeing . Concerned cabin crew rushed over to see what had caused the panic and began searching for the critter, which had already disappeared back inside the box.  The plane had set off from the Sultan Syar Kasim II International Airport in Pekanbaru, Indonesia on Thursday evening. Its not know how long the scorpion had been inside the plane, but it is believed to have been living deep within the aircraft for some time. Eyewitness Karim Taslin said: I was in row  with two other passengers, next to me Seeing the scorpion just above our seat, we rushed out as fast as we could.  I didnt have time to catch the scorpion, so it disappeared into the cabin baggage area.I pressed the emergency button. There was no response, so I shouted for help. Lion Air said in a statement that the plane had been sprayed a week earlier to remove any creatures and they are now investigating.Airline spokesman Danang Mandala Prihantoro said: Ground service officers and technicians immediately carried out in-depth search and thorough handling of the aircraft after the passengers and cargo were removed, but no animals were found.

title: schools replace mum dad parent
story: NewsSchools to replace mum and dad with Parent  and Parent The French government has started proceedings to change the law to get mother and father removed from all school paperworkShareCommentsByZoe ForseyActing Audience Editor:,  FEB NewsThe change will appear on school paperwork "Get the biggest daily news stories by emailSubscribeSee our privacy noticeMore newslettersThank you for subscribingWe have more newslettersShow meSee our privacy noticeCould not subscribe, try again laterInvalid EmailThe words mother and father couple be replaced by Parent  and Parent  in all French schools. The French government has started the legal process to make the change in a bid to avoid offending same-sex parents. However the move, which would see mum and dad removed from all school forms, has angered many people. Valeacuterie Petit, who tabled the amendment to the Schools of Trust law, said: No one should feel excluded from this society by backward thinking. The new phrases would appear on school forms.Other MPs agreed with the change and it passed its first reading last week, reports Mail Online .  This paves the way for it to be made law, and it is expected to pass the second reading tomorrow. The amendment reads: To prevent discrimination, school enrollment, class registers, parental authorisations and all other official forms involving children must mention only Parent  and Parent . However the idea has angered many, with education minister Jean-Michel Blanquer saying it was a legislative overreach. Alexandre Urwicz, President of the Association of Homo-parental Families, told local news outlets: At first, we welcomed the amendment because, technically, it allows our families to be included in forms that previously did not allow it.

Since she has been there, she has had three children, two of whom - a boy and a girl - died in infancy.She gave birth to a boy on Saturday who she has named Jarrah .The teenager insisted she did not ask to be the subject of international media attention.
